intro: Desmanthus covillei var. arizonicus, commonly known as the Arizona burr legume, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and distinctive, spiny pods that contain small, bean-like seeds. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of arid ecosystems.
